decks.notes: The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing various control elements. This includes countering their spells with Cancel and Mana Leak, removing their creatures with Disfigure and Doom Blade, and discarding their key cards with Duress and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also aims to maintain card advantage through drawing and filtering with cards like Sea Gate Oracle, Preordain, and Jace Beleren. The win condition is through gradual damage with creatures like Grave Titan and creeping damage with land creatures like Creeping Tar Pit.

The key strategy of this deck is to control the opponent's board through counterspells, removal, and discard spells, while generating card advantage and value through the use of planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while gradually building up its own resources before eventually overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats like Grave Titan. The mana base includes lands that can disrupt the opponent's mana base, giving the deck additional control options.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using cards like Joraga Treespeaker, Overgrown Battlement, and Explore. The goal is to get to high amounts of mana as quickly as possible to play powerful creatures like Avenger of Zendikar, Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, and Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre. The deck also utilizes cards like Primeval Titan and Growth Spasm to further accelerate mana and search for specific lands. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana early on to play expensive and impactful creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage. By using cards like Mana Leak, Doom Blade, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, the deck aims to disrupt opponent's game plan while steadily building card advantage and board presence. The deck also includes cards like Grave Titan and Creeping Tar Pit to provide win conditions. The main focus is to outvalue the opponent and maintain control of the game until victory is achieved.

The key concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and deal direct damage to quickly bring them down. The deck focuses on using low-cost creatures with abilities like haste and lifelink to put pressure on the opponent early on. It also includes burn spells like Burst Lightning and Lightning Bolt to take out threats and deal additional damage. The deck utilizes efficient land choices like Lavaclaw Reaches and Blackcleave Cliffs to ensure it has the necessary resources to maintain its aggressive strategy. Overall, the deck aims to quickly and relentlessly attack the opponent, overwhelming them before they can effectively respond.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by countering opponents' spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage through card draw and powerful planeswalkers. The deck aims to stall the opponent with removal spells like Disfigure and Doom Blade while protecting its win conditions like Grave Titan. The inclusion of counterspells like Mana Leak and Stoic Rebuttal helps in countering key spells, while planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide card advantage and control over the game. Overall, the deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent and win through incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells and removal spells while also using card draw and manipulation to maintain a steady stream of resources. The main win condition is by using creatures like Grave Titan and Sea Gate Oracle to apply pressure while also disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck also uses land destruction with cards like Tectonic Edge to gain an advantage and limit the opponent's resources. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's strategy, disrupt their hand, and maintain control of the game until it can secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using counter spells, board wipes, and removal spells while also generating card advantage with planeswalkers and card draw. The inclusion of powerful control finishers like Baneslayer Angel and the control planeswalkers Jace, Gideon, and Elspeth provide a win condition once the opponent has been neutralized. The deck's mana base allows for consistent blue and white mana sources, enabling the player to cast their spells efficiently and effectively. The goal is to out-value and outlast the opponent through careful decision-making and resource management.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells, counter spells, and card advantage. It focuses on using cards like Condemn, Day of Judgment, and Journey to Nowhere to deal with threats from the opponent's side of the board. It also utilizes counterspells like Mana Leak and Stoic Rebuttal to prevent the opponent from playing their key spells. Additionally, the deck aims to generate card advantage through the use of Squadron Hawk and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, while also having card selection with Preordain and Jace Beleren.

This deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly by playing efficient creatures and ramping up mana production with cards like Llanowar Elves and Arbor Elf. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks powered up by Ezuri, Renegade Leader and Wolfbriar Elemental, while also using cards like Fauna Shaman to search for key creatures like Vengevine. The deck also includes some utility cards like Eldrazi Monument to protect your creatures and provide a game-ending threat.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Goblin Guide, Plated Geopede, and Squadron Hawk, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of equipment like Sword of Body and Mind and Stoneforge Mystic provides additional ways to increase the deck's offensive capabilities. With a mana base that includes fetch lands and a variety of lands to ensure consistent access to both red and white mana, this deck is designed to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game.

The main concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. The deck focuses on early game pressure with impactful one-drop creatures like Vampire Lacerator and Pulse Tracker, backed up by powerful three-drops like Kalastria Highborn and Gatekeeper of Malakir. The deck also utilizes disruptive creatures like Bloodghast and Viscera Seer to maintain board presence and keep the pressure on the opponent. Removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Arc Trail help clear the way for your creatures to attack and finish off the opponent quickly.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by disrupting the opponent's plans with removal spells like Disfigure and Doom Blade, as well as countering their spells with Mana Leak. The deck also aims to generate card advantage and manipulate the board state with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Explore. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Frost Titan, Grave Titan, and Primeval Titan provide additional threats and win conditions. Additionally, ramping with Lotus Cobra and Oracle of Mul Daya helps accelerate the deck's game plan of controlling the game until it can establish a dominant position.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while also ramping up mana and controlling the board with removal spells and powerful creatures like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Avenger of Zendikar, and Frost Titan. By efficiently managing your resources and consistently hitting land drops, you can overwhelm your opponent with card advantage and big threats. The combination of card draw, counterspells, and efficient threats allows you to maintain control of the game and outvalue your opponent in the long run.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and disruption while slowly building up card advantage and tempo. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and card draw spells like Preordain to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents. The inclusion of Grave Titan provides a win condition that can close out games quickly once the opponent's resources have been depleted. By disrupting the opponent's game plan and maintaining control of the board, the deck aims to grind out a victory through attrition and careful decision-making.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage from Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Jace Beleren. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Duress and Memoricide while maintaining board control with cards like Grave Titan and Ratchet Bomb. The mana base is centered around producing the necessary colors for the spells and abilities in the deck, while also including utility lands like Tectonic Edge. Overall, the strategy revolves around controlling the game tempo and out-valuing the opponent through card advantage.

The deck focuses on using powerful control spells and creatures to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building card advantage through Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The key strategy is to control the board using counterspells like Mana Leak and Spell Pierce, removal spells like Doom Blade and Ratchet Bomb, and finish the game with powerful threats like Abyssal Persecutor and Grave Titan. The deck aims to outvalue opponents by generating card advantage, disrupting their plays, and ultimately securing victory through a combination of control and threats.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage provided by planeswalkers and draw spells. By efficiently controlling the board, the deck aims to stall the game until it can establish a win condition, such as using Celestial Colonnade as a finisher or recurring threats like Sun Titan. The deck's strategy revolves around denying the opponent's game plan while slowly building up its own resources to secure victory through attrition and powerful late-game plays.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through denial and disruption, using counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to maintain board control. The deck aims to stall out the opponent's game plan until it can establish a dominant position with powerful threats like Baneslayer Angel and Sun Titan. By preventing the opponent from establishing a strong board presence and disrupting their strategy, the deck can outlast its opponent and secure victory through attrition and superior card advantage.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and efficiently to control the game by playing powerful creatures like Primeval Titan and Avenger of Zendikar. By utilizing cards like Cultivate, Explore, and Growth Spasm, the deck aims to cheat out big threats early on and overwhelm the opponent with powerful landfall triggers from Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. The inclusion of Summoning Trap provides an additional way to cheat out creatures for added surprise factor. Overall, the deck aims to leverage its mana ramp to establish dominance and control the game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by ramping up mana quickly and generating value through landfall triggers. The deck aims to cheat out big threats like Avenger of Zendikar and Primeval Titan while controlling the board with cards like Pyroclasm. With a combination of ramp spells like Cultivate and Harrow, as well as land tutoring cards like Terramorphic Expanse and Evolving Wilds, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and burn spells from Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle.

This deck aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Cultivate, Explore, and Harrow to play powerful land cards like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and trigger its ability by playing Mountains. Avenger of Zendikar and Primeval Titan are crucial threats that work well with the deck's ramp strategy. The deck also includes cards like Inferno Titan and Pyroclasm for removal and board control. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the board while setting up for a powerful late-game win condition with land triggers and big creatures.

This deck focuses on ramping up resources quickly with cards like Lotus Cobra and Cultivate to efficiently bring out powerful threats such as Primeval Titan and Avenger of Zendikar. The goal is to control the game with board presence and mana advantage, while also utilizing Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. Misty Rainforest and Raging Ravine provide additional utility and reach in the mid to late game, while Summoning Trap can help cheat out big creatures for added pressure.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful landfall creatures like Avenger of Zendikar and Primeval Titan. By using cards like Harrow, Cultivate, and Khalni Heart Expedition, the deck can quickly get to its endgame threats. Lightning Bolt provides removal while Oracle of Mul Daya helps with card advantage. Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle serves as a win condition, dealing massive damage when enough Mountains are in play. Overall, the deck aims to control the game while setting up a powerful late game board presence.
